Monte Carlo simulation program specializing in tracking particles in electric and magnetic fields

17  template< class XValueType, class XDerivativeType, class XErrorType >
18  class KSMathInterpolator< KSMathSystem< XValueType, XDerivativeType, XErrorType > >
19  {
20  public:
21  KSMathInterpolator();
22  virtual ~KSMathInterpolator();

24  public:
25  virtual void Interpolate( double aTime,
26  const KSMathIntegrator< KSMathSystem< XValueType, XDerivativeType, XErrorType > >& anIntegrator,
27  const KSMathDifferentiator< KSMathSystem< XValueType, XDerivativeType, XErrorType > >& aDifferentiator,
28  const XValueType& anInitialValue,
29  const XValueType& aFinalValue,
30  const double& aStep,
31  XValueType& anInterpolatedValue ) const = 0;

33  virtual double DistanceMetric(const XValueType& valueA, const XValueType& valueB) const;
34 
35  //use tolerance and max segment parameters to govern recursive subdivision the step into linear segments
36  virtual void GetPiecewiseLinearApproximation( double aTolerance,
37  unsigned int nMaxSegments,
38  double anInitialTime, /*have to pass start time parameter because we cannot rely on in being part of the XValueType*/
39  double aFinalTime, /*have to pass end time parameter because we cannot rely on in being part of the XValueType*/
40  const KSMathIntegrator< KSMathSystem< XValueType, XDerivativeType, XErrorType > >& anIntegrator,
41  const KSMathDifferentiator< KSMathSystem< XValueType, XDerivativeType, XErrorType > >& aDifferentiator,
42  const XValueType& anInitialValue,
43  const XValueType& aFinalValue,
44  std::vector<XValueType>* interpolatedValues) const;
45 
46  //use fixed number of segments to evenly sample the entire step
47  virtual void GetPiecewiseLinearApproximation( unsigned int nSegments,
48  double anInitialTime, /*have to pass start time parameter because we cannot rely on in being part of the XValueType*/
49  double aFinalTime, /*have to pass end time parameter because we cannot rely on in being part of the XValueType*/
50  const KSMathIntegrator< KSMathSystem< XValueType, XDerivativeType, XErrorType > >& anIntegrator,
51  const KSMathDifferentiator< KSMathSystem< XValueType, XDerivativeType, XErrorType > >& aDifferentiator,
52  const XValueType& anInitialValue,

54  std::vector<XValueType>* interpolatedValues) const;

57  typedef typename std::pair<XValueType, bool> XValueFlagPair;
58  typedef typename std::list< XValueFlagPair > XValueFlagPairList;
59  typedef typename XValueFlagPairList::iterator XValueFlagPairListIter;

74  template< class XValueType, class XDerivativeType, class XErrorType >
75  double
76  KSMathInterpolator< KSMathSystem< XValueType, XDerivativeType, XErrorType > >::DistanceMetric
77  (
78  const XValueType& valueA,
79  const XValueType& valueB
80  )
81  const
82  {
83  //default is euclidean norm over all variabls present in the value type
84  //this can be overloaded by the user depending on the value type
85  //(e.g. may want only position variables to contribute and ignore momentum, etc)
86  double dist = 0.0;
87  double del;
88  for(unsigned int i=0; i<XValueType::sDimension; i++)
89  {
90  del = valueA[i] - valueB[i];
91  dist += del*del;
92  }
93  return std::sqrt(dist);
94  }
95 
96  template< class XValueType, class XDerivativeType, class XErrorType >
97  void
98  KSMathInterpolator< KSMathSystem< XValueType, XDerivativeType, XErrorType > >::GetPiecewiseLinearApproximation
99  (
100  double aTolerance,
101  unsigned int nMaxSegments,
102  double anInitialTime, /*have to pass start time parameter because we cannot rely on in being part of the XValueType*/
103  double aFinalTime, /*have to pass end time parameter because we cannot rely on in being part of the XValueType*/
104  const KSMathIntegrator< KSMathSystem< XValueType, XDerivativeType, XErrorType > >& anIntegrator,
105  const KSMathDifferentiator< KSMathSystem< XValueType, XDerivativeType, XErrorType > >& aDifferentiator,
106  const XValueType& anInitialValue,
107  const XValueType& aFinalValue,
108  std::vector<XValueType>* interpolatedValues
109  )
110  const
111  {
112  interpolatedValues->clear();
113 
114  //list of <value, bisect-flag> pairs
115  XValueFlagPairList tValues;
116  tValues.push_back( XValueFlagPair(anInitialValue, true) );
117  tValues.push_back( XValueFlagPair(aFinalValue, false) );
118  XValueFlagPairListIter tFirst = tValues.begin();
119  XValueFlagPairListIter tNext = tFirst; tNext++;
120 
121  //list of time parameters for each corresponding value
122  std::list< double > tValueTimes;
123  tValueTimes.push_back(anInitialTime);
124  tValueTimes.push_back(aFinalTime);
125  std::list< double >::iterator tFirstTime = tValueTimes.begin();
126  std::list< double >::iterator tNextTime = tFirstTime; tNextTime++;
127 
128  //temp variables for work
129  double tMidTime;
130  double tTimeStep;
131  XValueType tSegmentMidPoint;
132  XValueType tCurveMidPoint;
133  unsigned int segmentCount = 1;
134  bool haveUncheckedSegments = true;
135 
136  //now we recursively bisect until we reach the appropriate tolerance or max number of segments
137  while( haveUncheckedSegments && (segmentCount < nMaxSegments) )
138  {
139  tFirst = tValues.begin(); tNext = tFirst; tNext++;
140  tFirstTime = tValueTimes.begin(); tNextTime = tFirstTime; tNextTime++;
141 
142  //assume we have check all the segments until we encounter one otherwise
143  haveUncheckedSegments = false;
144 
145  //we do a breadth-first search for segments to bisect
146  while( (tNext != tValues.end()) && (segmentCount < nMaxSegments) )
147  {
148  //check if need for bisection flag is true
149  if(tFirst->second)
150  {
151  //compute line segment and curve mid-points
152  tSegmentMidPoint = 0.5*( (tFirst->first) + (tNext->first) );
153  tMidTime = 0.5*( *tFirstTime + *tNextTime );
154  tTimeStep = tMidTime - anInitialTime;
155  Interpolate(anInitialTime, anIntegrator, aDifferentiator, anInitialValue, aFinalValue, tTimeStep, tCurveMidPoint);
156 
157  //distance exceeds tolerance?
158  double dist = DistanceMetric(tSegmentMidPoint, tCurveMidPoint);
159  if(dist > aTolerance)
160  {
161  tFirst = tValues.insert(tNext, XValueFlagPair(tCurveMidPoint, true) );
162  tFirst++;
163  tNext = tFirst; tNext++;
164  tFirstTime = tValueTimes.insert(tNextTime, tMidTime);
165  tFirstTime++;
166  tNextTime = tFirstTime; tNextTime++;
167  haveUncheckedSegments = true; //will have to inspect this new segment on next pass
168  segmentCount++;
169  }
170  else
171  {
172  //no longer need to consider this segment for bisection
173  tFirst->second = false;
174  tFirst++; tNext++;
175  tFirstTime++; tNextTime++;
176  }
177  }
178  else
179  {
180  tFirst++; tNext++;
181  tFirstTime++; tNextTime++;
182  }
183  }
184  }
185 
186  //now fill up the output std::vector with the intermediate state results (in time order)
187  for(tFirst = tValues.begin(); tFirst != tValues.end(); tFirst++)
188  {
189  interpolatedValues->push_back(tFirst->first);
190  }
191  }
192 
193 
194  template< class XValueType, class XDerivativeType, class XErrorType >
195  void
196  KSMathInterpolator< KSMathSystem< XValueType, XDerivativeType, XErrorType > >::GetPiecewiseLinearApproximation
197  (
198  unsigned int nSegments,
199  double anInitialTime, /*have to pass start time parameter because we cannot rely on in being part of the XValueType*/
200  double aFinalTime, /*have to pass end time parameter because we cannot rely on in being part of the XValueType*/
201  const KSMathIntegrator< KSMathSystem< XValueType, XDerivativeType, XErrorType > >& anIntegrator,
202  const KSMathDifferentiator< KSMathSystem< XValueType, XDerivativeType, XErrorType > >& aDifferentiator,
203  const XValueType& anInitialValue,
204  const XValueType& aFinalValue,
205  std::vector<XValueType>* interpolatedValues
206  )
207  const
208  {
209  interpolatedValues->clear();
210  double delta = (aFinalTime - anInitialTime)/((double)nSegments);
211 
212  //insert the first state
213  interpolatedValues->push_back(anInitialValue);
214 
215  //compute linear sample of intermediate states
216  XValueType tState;
217  for(unsigned int i=1; i<nSegments; i++)
218  {
219  double tTimeStep = i*delta;
220  Interpolate(anInitialTime, anIntegrator, aDifferentiator, anInitialValue, aFinalValue, tTimeStep, tState);
221  interpolatedValues->push_back(tState);
222  }
223 
224  //insert the last state
225  interpolatedValues->push_back(aFinalValue);
226  }
227 
228 }
229 
230 #endif
